Oh man this brings back memories. I have been in decent shape for most of my life playing football from a young age. After I finished school in the summer I decided to go for a run-1km. Well I did about 0.5 and I was absolutely dying-how could I be this unfit when I play sport I thought? It was hell. But I kept at it got better and more consistent. In my second year of uni I switched to a treadmill (way better in my opinion) and it's helped a ton. Being able to dictate the speed from the machine makes it so much better and means you don't go to fats and wear yourself out.
I think that's the key don't go to fast, even though you said you were jogging you still ate have been overdoing it. So now I run 10km fast three times a week - and my stamina and insides feel fine! I like to do it everyday if I could but my legs wouldn't let me-so don't worry that pain does go away-for me it felt like I had to clean out my insides before they could function normally for running. It won't be easy but keep at it and you should feel way better!
Also one thing I'd say is set yourself a target and no matter how many times you stop for a break make sure you reach it, don't get disheartened and stop if you can't make the whole distance in one go

He asks if she has read it then sits down. He looks towards the window and says 'I can smell the ocean', to which Anna does not respond. How a Horizon and Witcher crossover could work...
WRITING.TEXT:
So CD Projekt and Guerrilla have been happily retweeting pictures of Aloy and Geralt together which got me thinking into how both games could crossover now I've completed both.
So Ciri (Geralts 'Daughter') has the power to travel through dimensions. In the Witcher world humans entered it through an event that transported them from another dimension-maybe Earth could exist as another dimension? So some event could happen and Aloy could be transported to the Witcher world where she teams up with Ciri and Geralt is transported to Earth where maybe he teams up with one if the cast.
Since the games have similar mechanics (especially the tracking one) you could have Aloy and Ciri team up for a Witcher contract, and Geralt could hunt down one of Horizon's bigger beasts. The could just phrase this whole event like Red Dead Redemptions 'Undead Nightmare'.
I know it couldn't happen but the thought of seeing Ciri and Aloy interact and Geralt commenting on the world of Horizon just makes me excited. What do you guys think?
